description: This project gives an overview of different ways to modify the  environment of your level through Flowgraph.

1.description: This graph is a simple setup for the level and the environment.
1.name: Level Setup

7.description: This is the state graph for this project.
7.name: States

107.commentText: This project gives an overview of different ways to modify the  environment of your level through Flowgraph.\nExplore the different flowgraphs to see all the possibilites or hit play to see them in action.

12.description: This graph contains the main activities for the project.
12.name: Main Activities

108.commentText: Explore the different flowgraphs to see different ways to modify the environment of your level.\n

18.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Set Time of Day" node.
18.name: Controlling Time Of Day

63.commentText:
The "Set Time of Day" node provides different possibilities for controlling
the day and night cycle of the level.
You can set things like:
- overall time
- should the time continue passing after setting it
- length of day and night cycles

Here we are changing the value from 0->1 over and over again.
This creates a smooth transition because:
- 0 = noon
- 0.25 = sundown
- 0.5 = midnight
- 0.75 = sunrise
- 1 = noon

message.value: Let's modify the time of day

33.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Set Cloud by ID" node.
33.name: Controlling Clouds

message.value: Okay, now let's modify their exposure
Now for a bit of wind
We can also change their height

9342.commentText:
You can modify the amount of coverage your cloud has.
Simply pass in the id of the cloud you want to modify
and a value for the coverage between 0 and 1.
Here we are changing the value from 0->0.85.

9343.commentText: You can modify the amount of exposure your clouds get.\nThis is acts as a simple brightness scale.\nHere we are changing the value from 0.65->0->0.8.

9344.commentText: You can also change the speed at which your clouds move.\nHere we are changing the value between 0.5->3.5.

9345.commentText: You can modify the height of the clouds. This does\nnot mean modifying their y-position in the world space,\nbut changing how flat or spread out they are on the y-axis.

50.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Set ScatterSky" node.
50.name: Controlling ScatterSky

message.value: Okay, next we will look at modifying the sky and its effects
First let's look at the overall brightness
Now we will raise the distance at which shadows are visible. Look around, you might see them popping in.
Okay, now let's make those shadows a bit softer

message_1.value: Atlast you can adjust the logWeight to handle the balance between the sharpness of close and far shadows

9350.commentText: The easiest thing to modify is the brightness of your sky.\nIt will not only impact the brightness of the sky, but also the shadows in the world.\nHere we are changing the value from 80->5->125.

9351.commentText:
This controls the maximum distance from the camera (not the car)
from which shadows are rendered.
Here we are changing the value from 500->2000.
This causes shadows to pop up, that were not rendered before.

9352.commentText: You can also modify the softness of your shadows, so they don't have hard edges.\nHere we are changing the value from 0.2->0.4.\nIncreasing the softness too high, will make the shadows hard to see.

9353.commentText:
One of the more complex things you can modify is the balance of the sharpness
between far and near shadows.
Usually you want a high value for this, because near shadows are the
most important to be visible.
Here we are only changing this value from 0.985->0.95 which already has 
visible effects on this balance.

84.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Set Fog" node.
84.name: Controlling Fog

message.value: Okay, let's look at creating some fog
We can also adjust the distance at which fogs starts to appear
Next we will raise the height of the fog. Look at the mountains to your left to see it rise.

9358.commentText: To actually make fog appear in your level, you have to set\na high enough value for its density.\nHere we are changing it from 0.001->0.125.

9359.commentText:
You can also control the distance from your camera
at which fog starts to appear.
Here we are changing the value from 2->100.

9360.commentText: This simply controls to which heights your fog will appear.\nHere we are changing it from 80->300.

92.description: This graph shows you how to control gravity.
92.name: Controlling Gravity

message.value: Atlast we can also adjust gravity in all directions

9362.commentText:
The "Directional Gravity" node will set the gravity for a specific vehicle.
With this node the gravity can be directional, meaning it can be set
through a vec3 value.
The input value can be modified by a certain magnitude.

9363.commentText:
Gravity is one of the most intuitive and fun things to change up.
The "Set Gravity" node controls the gravity for the whole level.
Natural gravity is around -9.81, so if you want to things to float up,
you will need a positive value.
Consider that setting a higher value for gravity will mean
that cars will have a harder time gaining traction.

202.description: This graph simply handles the end of the project.
202.name: End State

name: EnvironmentBasics
